title: The Garden Guardian: A Week in the Life of Jin Gonzales
summary: Jin Gonzales, a 70-year-old with a passion for sculpting and gardening, discovers he has the power to control plants and uses it to protect his neighborhood from danger.
summaryGerman: Jin Gonzales, ein 70-Jähriger mit einer Leidenschaft für Bildhauerei und Gartenarbeit, entdeckt, dass er die Fähigkeit hat, Pflanzen zu kontrollieren und benutzt sie, um seine Nachbarschaft vor Gefahren zu schützen.
summaryDutch: Jin Gonzales, een 70-jarige met een passie voor beeldhouwen en tuinieren, ontdekt dat hij de kracht heeft om planten te beheersen en gebruikt deze om zijn buurt te beschermen tegen gevaar.
summaryFrench: Jin Gonzales, âgé de 70 ans et passionné de sculpture et de jardinage, découvre qu'il a le pouvoir de contrôler les plantes et l'utilise pour protéger son quartier du danger.

story.text: At the break of dawn, Jin Gonzales discovers his newfound ability to communicate with plants while tending his garden.
Empowered by his abilities, Jin constructs floral sculptures that move and delight the neighborhood children.
Jin hears about a plan to cut down the local park's old trees; he vows to stop it.
Using his plant control, Jin organises a peaceful protest with the trees themselves participating, swaying ominously to deter the contractors.
The town's mayor visits Jin's garden to understand his connection with nature and becomes a supporter of preserving the park.
With the community behind him, Jin's garden becomes a symbol of resistance and hope.
Celebrating their victory, Jin and his neighbors hold a festival in the rejuvenated park, filled with sculptures and flourishing greenery.

moral: With passion and unity, even the smallest voices can protect and transform a community.
ending: Jin Gonzales, now known as the Garden Guardian, continued to inspire those around him, proving that age is but a number when it comes to making a difference.
